programme.title: At the Earth's Core (1976)
programme.desc: A Victorian professor invents a super-powerful tunnelling machine that can dig its way through the Earth's crust. To impress his financial backer he gives a demonstration, but his invention malfunctions and bores a channel to the very centre of the Earth - where they discover a prehistoric human race enslaved by flying telepathic monsters. Sci-fi adventure based on the book by Edgar Rice Burroughs, with Peter Cushing, Doug McClure, Caroline Munro and Cy Grant

programme.title: Crystal Skulls (2014)
programme.desc: The Earth faces destruction from a black hole in space causing environmental disasters across the world. As a fleet of space arks is constructed to save the human race, a team of scientists ventures into the South American jungle in search of 12 magical skulls that can save the world from destruction. Fantasy adventure, starring Richard Burgi and Wendy Glenn

programme.title: Tremors 3: Back to Perfection (2001)
programme.desc: Gun-toting adventurer Burt Gummer returns to his home town of Perfection, where he battles the newest flying mutation of giant killer sandworms with the help of a lowly tour guide. Meanwhile, crooked land developers are planning to turn the area into a money-spinning tourist trap. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Michael Gross, Shawn Christian, Susan Chuang and Charlotte Stewart

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The usually rational Mr Spock begins to behave out of character, becoming strangely erratic and eventually requesting leave to return to his home planet - where he ends up fighting Captain Kirk in a duel to the death. Sci-fi adventure, starring William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Vampire Circus (1971)

Hammer Horror, with Adrienne Corri, Anthony Higgins, Laurence Payne, Thorley Walters and Robert Tayman

programme.title: Interview with a Hitman (2012)
programme.desc: An assassin is raised to be the perfect killing machine in the slums of Romania, but when his masters betray him, he fakes his death and tries to start a new life in London. However, he soon finds his dark past coming back to haunt him. Action thriller, starring Luke Goss, Caroline Tillette and Danny Midwinter

programme.title: Jiu Jitsu (2020)
programme.desc: Every six years an alien species forces an ancient order of jiu-jitsu warriors to come together in order to fight the invaders. The battlefield is destabilized when a celebrated war hero falls in defeat leaving the other warriors on their own. Action sci-fi, starring Nicolas Cage, Alain Moussi, Eddie Steeples and Marie Avgeropoulos

programme.title: Iron Sky: The Coming Race (2019)
programme.desc: It's 2047 and Earth has been destroyed by nuclear war. The last of mankind, struggling to co-exist on the moon, race to battle an extraordinary enemy and save humanity. It's a conflict involving dinosaurs, near-death experiences and Nazis. Fantasy sequel to cult movie Iron Sky, starring Lara Rossi, Vladimir Burlakov and Kit Dale

programme.title: Firequake (2014)
programme.desc: A new clean energy source is created that provides enough power to sustain the world's energy needs, but several governments misuse the technology, resulting in devastating volcanic eruptions across the globe. The scientist who created the process tries to find a way to undo the damage before it destroys the Earth. Sci-fi disaster, starring Alexandra Paul and Kirsty Mitchell

programme.title: Kill Command (2016)
programme.desc: An elite military unit is flown to a top secret facility for a training exercise. The soldiers are intended to be put to the test in a battle simulation against robots, but when the machines start trying to really kill them, they discover a deadly threat to the human race. Sci-fi thriller, starring Vanessa Kirby and Thure Lindhardt

programme.title: Mindscape (2013)
programme.desc: A psychic with the ability to explore people's memories uses his talents to aid the police, until a case goes disastrously wrong. Desperate for work, he agrees to help a wealthy couple discover why their teenage daughter is on a hunger strike, but beings to fear she is manipulating her memories to deceive him. Fantasy thriller, starring Mark Strong, Taissa Farmiga and Brian Cox

programme.title: The Disappearance (1977)
programme.desc: A hit-man is shattered by the mysterious disappearance of his wife, and when his concern begins to affect his work, he vows to find out what's really going on. However, he soon realises the mystery might be connected to his latest job - and finds the trail leads him to the man at the top of his organisation. Haunting thriller with plenty to keep viewers gripped, starring Donald Sutherland, Francine Racette, David Hemmings and David Warner

programme.title: Shed of the Dead (2019)
programme.desc: While painting wargame figurines in an allotment shed, two men learn that the zombie apocalypse has begun - and the only way to survive is to have life imitate art. Comic horror, starring Spencer Brown, Lauren Socha and Ewen MacIntosh

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mac's jealousy is aroused by the discovery that Rana and Steve have a stunning admirer, and tongues wag over what he did to upset Helen. Meanwhile, Anoushka and Ruth do some investigating

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Anoushka visits a dying friend, while Kate sets out to catch the person responsible for stealing biscuits from the staff room. Meanwhile, twins with a penchant for gambling accompany their ailing mother to the surgery. Christopher Timothy and Jacqueline Leonard star

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ollie tries to shut Tara out when they work together on a sensitive case, leading to an argument that threatens his professional standing and his duty of care to a teenager struggling to accept his mother is dying. Ric believes Serena does not have a patient's best interests at heart and betrays her to Hanssen, while Eddi is in a bad mood over Luc's departure and has no time for anyone today. She thinks she has found a kindred spirit in rebellious old patient Vincent - until he angers her by refusing the surgery he so desperately needs. Ron Moody (Oliver!) guest stars in the medical drama

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The team have to cope with a teenage girl runaway, and a young man who almost drowns in the local swimming pool

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Newcomer Claire wastes little time in making her presence felt at the practice, and accepts Alex's offer to move in with her _ only to repay the favour by getting her claws into Tom. Meanwhile, Will wonders how many more revelations about his son he can take as the news that he's soon to become a grandad slowly sinks in. Rural medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd and Gray O'Brien

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Diana watches calmly as Tom completes a bungee jump, and Harvey is informed that any preaching he does will be grounds for fraud charges. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene reluctantly assists the Resistance as they set out to blow up a railway line, but the mission is jeopardised when Edith mistakes the explosives for gin. Meanwhile, a plane from London supposedly transporting German uniforms turns out to contain a tailor

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Compo discover Foggy thinks they should devote themselves to first aid, after a life-saving attempt ends in a drenching

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo try to make Sid appear dashing in Ivy's eyes, convincing Weasley to use him in his latest experiment. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, John Comer and Gordon Wharmby

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A housewife dies of chemical poisoning during her weekly shopping trip and the detectives immediately suspect they have a case of terrorism on their hands, However, a second death points them toward a health retreat with a troubled past and a mysterious woman named Barbara Lennox. Stephen Tompkinson guest stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry is forced to confront his past when the team reinvestigates the 33-year-old murder of a doctor whose body was found hanging from a meat hook on a butcher's stall at Smithfield Market. The butcher had gone missing on the same day, and since then the community has rallied to help his widow keep the business afloat. However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. Nikki and Jack investigate when a man is run down and killed by a Tube train - although not long after, a female vicar is murdered on the Underground, leaving them with the difficult prospect of building a case against her distraught husband. However, when a young roofer is stalked and brutally killed on his journey home, CCTV cameras pick up a suspect who links the deaths, and a full-scale manhunt is launched. Meanwhile, Nikki forms a bond with one of the detectives, who asks her to help re-evaluate his father's murder when he was a child. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The return of Mackenzie Crook's award-winning comedy in which he and Toby Jones star as metal detector enthusiasts in search of their hearts' desire. Andy is considering internet dating. Not for him, but for Lance, who is still not over the departure of his ex-wife. Meanwhile, a mysterious stranger arrives to tempt the metal detecting club - in more ways than one. Real-life mother and daughter Diana Rigg and Rachael Stirling co-star, with Gerard Horan and Sophie Thompson

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Dr Rana Mistry astonishes Mac with his somewhat unorthodox treatments, and two elderly patients get into a spot of trouble. Meanwhile, Helen attempts to help a girl come to terms with motherhood. Christopher Timothy stars

programme.desc: While Kat and Andy's wedding is in progress, Alfie arrives and interrupts the ceremony, wishing to speak to Kat

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer offers to track down a conman after Charlie is swindled out of a china figurine. He also helps Charlotte find the thieves who've robbed her house. Drama, guest starring Lionel Jeffries and Eve Matheson

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The outbreak of a deadly stomach bug puts strain on the practice, and angry residents target a group of travellers they believe to be responsible. Meanwhile, Claire does her wicked best to drive a wedge between Alex and Tom, and Kate falls out with Will over his treatment of an asthmatic who is also a convicted arsonist. Rural medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd, Eva Pope and Victor McGuire

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Jane and Diana's strip-club hen night proves to be a real eye-opener, then a double booking with a funeral at the church throws the happy couples' wedding plans into chaos. Comedy, starring Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: While on a sabotage mission, Rene is captured by General Von Klinkerhoffen, who promptly orders the Colonel to inflict drastic punishment on him - but rather than going through with the grisly event, he arranges to fake the cafe owner's death instead

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy persuades Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily countryside rambles. However, the experience proves to be more of a workout than the trio envisage. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo hit on a solution to their transport problems - building their own bikes. Meanwhile, Sid and Ivy's cafe has been redecorated and is set for its grand re-opening. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter takes on a complex legal and moral case at the local medical research facility, while Nigel and Lyle try to save an order of nuns from eviction. Beatrice launches an adult chatline to fund Petra's school fees - but the new venture soon attracts a call from none other than the girl's father. Guest starring Jaye Griffiths and Anna Massey, with Stephen Fry, John Thomson and Karl Davies

programme.title: Maisie Raine
programme.desc: The theft and subsequent criminal misuse of DC Tomlin's warrant card adds to DI Raine's troubles as she identifies the body of a local drugs dealer and faces an outbreak of gang warfare on her patch - and it's not long before a second corpse is retrieved from the canal. Police drama, starring Pauline Quirke and Steve John Shepherd

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the death of wealthy financier Douglas Anderson when psychic Sebastian Carter informs the deceased's daughter that she needs to resolve her father's unfinished business. The retired officers set out to prove the clairvoyant is a fraud after growing suspicious of his 'gift', but Pullman struggles to dismiss the supposed conman when a conflict involving her own late father emerges. Detective drama, guest starring David Bradley

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A suspected paedophile is found dead in a playground, so inexperienced detective Rory Drennan calls in Nikki and Jack to attend. It's not long before the team links his murder to the case of a missing young girl, so the child-protection officers are also brought in - though it soon becomes apparent the youngster's social worker blames herself for the disappearance. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Claudie Blakley, Lorraine Burroughs and John Dagliesh

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Sophie seems to be making progress with her new friend at the library, while the club is visited by the mayor on a matter of some delicacy. Peter's quest to find his grandmother has attracted the attention of some old enemies and Andy spots something suspicious. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Daniel Donskov

programme.desc: Katrina is devastated by Jimmy's revelations, Jude gets involved in a family's domestic problems, and Marc returns to work but his colleagues suspect he is not yet over his mother's death. Medical drama, starring Natalie Robb

programme.desc: Tara tries to win Jac's support for a research project, but she refers her to Ollie instead - forcing the young doctor to consider how she feels about him. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Duffy's relationship with Kelly is strained and a group of teenage joyriders end up on the wards. Meanwhile, a woman with fictional ailments gains the attention of medical staff

Meanwhile, Gabriel Kent is desperate to cover up his frenzied attack on his colleague, but no amount of tampering with the evidence can make Gina Gold or Dale Smith believe his statement

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Garry gets it on with Belinda in the Arches. Dennis confronts Den after making a startling discovery. Victor proves the lengths he'll go to win back Yolande

programme.desc: Victor offers Patrick fifteen grand to ditch Yolande. Patrick and Yolande's relationship is thrown into jeopardy

Rural medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd and Eva Pope

Claire brings in a delicately painted wardrobe given to her great grandparents to celebrate their marriage. Wood restorer Will Kirk tries to save the broken cupboard which is completely missing a back board and internal shelves. The final visitor to the barn is Jane who brings in a rickety old ironing board for the attention of Dominic Chinea that reminds her of the time her and her husband couldn't afford a home and lived in a squat

programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits the seaside town of Ayr, combing through its good-looking property stock and popular culture haunts. With £400,000 in their pocket, her buyers have pinpointed Ayr as a potential perfect town because it puts them a walk from the beach and a train ride from the buzz of Glasgow. They soon discover it's a real gem of a place, with a multi-generational crowd thanks to its university campus and lively theatre scene, as well as award-winning local seafood on the waterfront

Having been given to their late father Brian when he was born in the 1960s, the sisters want to give the toy to his grandson Harrison to keep his memory alive. Sukeshi brings in a watch given to her by her mother that symbolises her fight for her daughter to lead an independent life despite her disabilities. Horologist Steve Fletcher teams up with Kirsten Ramsay to try get the watch ticking again. The final visitors to the barn, Kegham and his daughter Karine, bring in a sporting trophy for the attention of silversmith Brenton West. Now aged 97, Kegham won the trophy in the 1950s when he was a part of a tennis club in Cyprus

As she listens to recordings the original investigator made, Sian discovers the Welsh words for disabled and child had allegedly appeared on the walls. Sian meets with one of the Gower daughters to ask whether at the time she believed that to be the monk apparition focussing in one family member

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone

She speaks to the daughters of the couple that owned the house at the height of the haunting to question them one last time and Dr Daniels finds a similar case in Spain that might provide a clue as to how the haunting might have been a hoax

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Mark Draisey, a caricaturist who switched disciplines after 30 years to become a traditional portrait painter, creates the final image of the series, depicting hospital porter Holly. When her eight-year-old daughter Renae was diagnosed with a brain tumour, Holly was overwhelmed by the care and support her family received and wanted to give back to the service. After five years of remission, Renae has fully recovered and aspires to join the NHS as a midwife one day

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

Qatar's Mutaz Essa Barshim is the reigning high jump champion after clearing 2.37m last year in Eugene, and Feng Bin of China's 69.12m was enough to prevail in the discus. On the track, heats take place in the women's 100m hurdles and men's 800m at 5.40 and 6.20 respectively

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Retired couple Liz and Paul from Norwich reach out to Angela Scanlon for help redesigning their three-bed home that has become unmanageable for Liz who has a degenerative bone disease. Architects Lynsey Elliott and Damion Burrows create their own designs to make the home perfect for the couple and allow them to see what it would look like using virtual reality and visual effects to help them decide which one to choose. Lynsey blows the pair away with her wedge-shaped extension but Damion's joyous bright colour scheme brings Paul to tears

Drama, starring Elliot James Langridge, Josh Whitehouse, Steve Coogan and Ricky Tomlinson

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Snowdon, or Yr Wyddfa, is the most popular mountain in Britain, attracting three-quarters of a million visitors each year - and it only getting busier. This documentary follows the work that goes in to keeping the tourists happy, including the maintenance of the five-mile mountain railway, which not only carries visitors but also supplies to the shop and cafe and even water and waste to and from the toilets. Meanwhile, wardens patrol the mountain to ensure the safety of walkers, and volunteers spends their weekends collecting tons of discarded rubbish

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Manchester Originals v Southern Brave (Start-time 3.00pm). Isa Guha presents live coverage of the women's match from Emirates Old Trafford, Manchester. The visitors claimed a nine-run victory in this meeting last year, as the Originals fell short of their target of 137. The Brave made their total of 136-5 thanks mainly to Indian batter Smriti Mandhana, who made 43 from just 25 balls. In reply Emma Lamb made 57 from 45 balls but it wasn't enough for the home side

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Manchester Originals v Southern Brave (Start-time 6.30pm). Isa Guha presents live coverage of the men's match from Emirates Old Trafford, Manchester. The Originals won by 68 runs when the sides met in Southampton last year, with England limited overs captain Jos Buttler top scoring with 68 off 42 balls. That result helped them to reach the knockout stage, and they eventually finished the campaign as runners-up to Trent Rockets

programme.desc: Georgie assures her fellow brokers that she has clients who are interested in a beautiful country house, but where does it leave her when the potential buyers don't even show up? Vanesa didn't get any offers from her open house in Monaco and is now worried that her mother is going to cut her off, while Krish is not convinced about working in London and meets up with an old contact from Leicester. The millionaire entrepreneur is looking for a new family home, but he has a very specific list of criteria and is refusing to share exactly what they are with Krish

programme.desc: Tom meets trailblazing operators who are risking everything to redefine the British pub, while trying to navigate the cost-of-living crisis. He also discloses details of the last woman to be imprisoned under the Witchcraft Acts, and unearths files that reveal the Church's role in slavery

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon appraise antiques at Guildford Cathedral, with items including a Moorcroft bowl and a wooden snuff holder. Presented by Paul Martin

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of day six from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where the finals of the men's long jump and women's hammer get under way at 6.30 and 7.15 respectively, with China's Wang Jianan and Brooke Andersen of USA the reigning champions. On the track, the women's and men's 200m semi-finals take place at 6.45 and 7.20, and the men's 800m semis at 7.50

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef turns his attention to street food which is experiencing a boom when the industry is struggling. In the West Midlands, Tom meets Jack Brabant and James Swinburne, founders of an expanding street food collective called Digbeth Dining Club. They curate street food events and venues, bringing together the best independent local traders with DJs and live music to create a new kind of dining experience

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Cherry Healey get special access to the JCB factory in Rocester in Staffordshire, where as many as a hundred iconic yellow diggers are made every single day. Gregg follows the production of their best-known model, the backhoe loader, so-called because it has got a loader shovel on the front and a hoe arm for digging on the back

programme.title: No Activity
programme.desc: Things get awkward over the radio as Hendy and April reveal to Stokes and Carol that they recently went on a date together. Elsewhere, there is anxiety for Carol as her wayward son Lachy has been suspended from school again

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Walsall's top social media talent Manrika reveals how to be a successful and in-demand influencer, including tips on interacting with followers, promoting an aspirational lifestyle, selling healthy habits and negotiating hotel stays. Comedy, starring Manrika Khaira

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Brock and Kristi return from a blissful vacation only to be crushed by reality. Orna has a breakthrough with Sean. Josh and Natasha make a surprising turn

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: It comes down to the wire as the planners battle to impress the judges and pull off a millionaire's garden party for Lauren and Jodie

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Croydon, south London, to help new parents Adam and Jen with their unfinished nursery. After discovering they were expecting twins, DIY took a back seat, leaving the couple with no storage for their baby kit. The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: In the quarter-final, the remaining celebrities cook a two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also previous Celebrity MasterChef finalists Andi Peters, Rylan and Vicky Pattison. The contestants need to pull out all the stops as they try to to secure their place in the semi-finals

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder travel by seaplane to go behind the scenes of Joali hotel resort in the Maldives, which offers guests a luxury experience despite its remote location. Rob discovers there are 300 workers hidden in the centre of the island, while Monica finds out how food is supplied to the island chefs. They realise that delivering paradise is like a giant theatre production

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: River Walks
programme.desc: Former Coronation Street star Shobna Gulati takes a stroll through Shropshire and Worcestershire along the banks of the Severn, Great Britain's longest river, finding out about a part of the country that is a world away from her native north-west England

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank and Betty travel to the seaside for a second honeymoon, hoping to make up for the catastrophes of the first. All seems to be going to plan - until they reach the hotel. Classic comedy, starring Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice. Originally broadcast in 1973

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Cutbacks to the civil service threaten the permanent secretary's position so Sir Humphrey tries to manipulate Hacker into abandoning his new policy. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola and Olly lock themselves away in a hotel room to try to finish preparing an important speech for the annual party conference. However, it is Glenn who hits the spot when he enlists the help of a local people's champion with a tragic tale. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Chris Addison

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: A look at the complex history and impact of grime music, from its DIY collaborative origins in London council estates and pirate radio to its complicated emergence into the mainstream, tracking its enormous influence and resonance along the way

programme.title: Rolling Stones: Crossfire Hurricane (2012)
programme.desc: Director Brett Morgen provides a new perspective on the Stones' unparalleled journey from blues-obsessed teenagers in the early '60s to rock royalty - a journey from the Marquee Club to Hyde Park, from Altamont to 'Exile and from club gigs to stadium extravaganzas. Featuring extensive historical footage, much of it widely unseen, with contemporary commentaries by Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Charlie Watts, Ronnie Wood and former Stones Bill Wyman and Mick Taylor

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland

programme.title: River Walks
programme.desc: Former Coronation Street star Shobna Gulati takes a stroll through Shropshire and Worcestershire along the banks of the Severn, Great Britain's longest river, finding out about a part of the country that is a world away from her native north-west England

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: The art historian traces the effects of the West's contact with the peoples and cultures of the Pacific, beginning with the impact on the Aborigines of Captain Cook's arrival in Australia in 1770. He reveals how the indigenous people were almost destroyed by European colonisation, but held on to their art to survive, flourish and ultimately share their extraordinary culture with the world

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The latest stage of Michael Portillo's trek takes him past lochs and castles on the Far North Line to Britain's northernmost railway station at Thurso. From Lairg on the banks of Loch Shin, Michael heads for a secret conservation area in the 18-mile-long loch to track down one of Scotland's most elusive and endangered species, the freshwater pearl mussel

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of the Northumberland village of Warkworth. With the help of locals he discovers clues that point back almost 1,000 years to the Norman conquest, revealing how the invaders laid the foundations of a planned community still visible to this day

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The professor continues her exploration of the real ancient Rome, descending into the streets to reveal a vast metropolis with little urban planning and poor sanitation. Mary also finds out where the Romans went to hang out, get drunk, have sex and get clean, and visits the Forum, where all manner of activities took place, from gambling and prostitution to dentistry. Along the way she tells the story of three citizens, including an apartment dweller who lived in fear of the rent collector and a seven-year-old girl killed in one of the city's many fires

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: Drama-documentary that uses the Colosseum to tell the thrilling story of the rise and fall of the Roman Empire. As the Roman Empire continued to expand, so did the diversity of exotic beasts brought back to entertain the Colosseum crowds. Over one million animals were slaughtered in the arena by trained beast masters, none more famous than Carpophorus

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: Drama-documentary charting the rise and fall of the Roman Empire through the Colosseum, one of the most exhilarating and brutal arenas in the history of humanity. Here, the mighty Emperor Trajan throws his great games of AD 107, and the crowd is treated to a rare spectacle - female gladiators

programme.title: Inside Culture
programme.desc: Mary analyses the worlds of architecture and fashion during the pandemic, noting that while the clothes people wear have already changed, cities and homes need to change to accommodate new ways of living. She also compares the new normal with life in ancient Rome, and fulfils a 40-year ambition by reuniting three cast members of 1970s BBC drama I, Claudius - Derek Jacobi, Sian Phillips and Brian Blessed

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Augustus learns of Livilla's lies over the rape allegation when Claudius tells Germanicus, and he travels to Corsica to pardon Postumus and reinstate him in Rome. Livia learns her husband has secretly revised his will when she talks to the Chief Vestal

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Piso and his wife are charged with the murder of Germanicus. As the trial proceeds, the couple decide the only way out is a joint suicide. However, as Plancina takes hold of the dagger, an unexpected turn of events takes place. Drama, starring Derek Jacobi, John Hurt and Sian Phillips. Part of the Visions of Rome Season

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Lollia is unable to live with the memory of being abused by Tiberius and commits suicide. Meanwhile, he banishes his mother from government and out of his life after growing tired of her meddling. Livilla plots to remove Castor from the picture so she and Sejanus can be together. Part of the Visions of Rome Season

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The latest stage of Michael Portillo's trek takes him past lochs and castles on the Far North Line to Britain's northernmost railway station at Thurso. From Lairg on the banks of Loch Shin, Michael heads for a secret conservation area in the 18-mile-long loch to track down one of Scotland's most elusive and endangered species, the freshwater pearl mussel

programme.title: Rome: A History of the Eternal City
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore charts Rome's rise from the abandonment and neglect of the 14th century into the everlasting seat of the Papacy recognised today. His story begins with the debauchery and decadence of the Renaissance, and takes viewers through the Catholic Reformation and on to the arrival of fascism and the creation of the Vatican State. He steps inside sensational palaces and churches, and talks about some of the world's most beloved art as he brings his exploration of Rome to a close

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The professor continues her exploration of the real ancient Rome, descending into the streets to reveal a vast metropolis with little urban planning and poor sanitation. Mary also finds out where the Romans went to hang out, get drunk, have sex and get clean, and visits the Forum, where all manner of activities took place, from gambling and prostitution to dentistry. Along the way she tells the story of three citizens, including an apartment dweller who lived in fear of the rent collector and a seven-year-old girl killed in one of the city's many fires

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Britain's northernmost station at Thurso in Caithness, Michael Portillo heads for the ferry port of Scrabster to cross the Pentland Firth to the Orkney Islands. Passing the Old Man of Hoy, Michael takes in stunning views of the Orkney archipelago and the rugged coastlines of its 70 islands

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle scales Britain's most renowned structures to tell the story of how constructions have changed over a period of 1,000 years, beginning with Durham Cathedral - one of the finest surviving examples of Norman architecture in the UK. He encounters the crumbling millennium-old stone with oyster shells hiding in the mortar, discovers carved stone arches and braves a tightrope nearly 100 feet above the nave. He is aided on his travels by Lucy Creamer, one of the country's top climbers

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The first of two programmes originally shown to mark the 80th birthday of acclaimed actor and director Richard Attenborough, celebrating his long career in showbusiness, from his renowned portrayal of gangster Pinkie in Graham Greene's Brighton Rock to his white-haired Dr John Hammond in Jurassic Park. With contributions from friends and family. First shown in 2003

programme.title: Shadowlands (1993)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the later life of novelist CS Lewis, detailing how he fell in love with American poet Joy Gresham, only to see his new-found happiness marred by tragedy and illness. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger, Edward Hardwicke, John Wood, Michael Denison and Joseph Mazzello

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Part two of two. Profile of acclaimed actor and director Richard Attenborough, charting his long career in showbusiness and following his day-to-day life as he visits a Leicester disability centre and addresses the students of Sussex University. With contributions from David Attenborough, John Attenborough, Sheila Sim and Ben Kingsley. First shown in 2003

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: An insight into the life and work of actor and director Richard Attenborough, with vintage interviews and classic archive clips illustrating a career that made him one of British cinema's most popular and successful figures. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: The RKO Story: Tales from Hollywood
programme.desc: The success of RKO Radio Pictures through the eyes of those who worked there, concluding with a look at Howard Hughes buying the company - and the devastating effect it had on the studio. Edward Asner presents, with contributions from Janet Leigh, Joan Fontaine, Jane Russell, Joan Simmons, Jane Greer, Robert Mitchum and Stewart Granger

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: Actor Paul McGann explores the 1890s, a decade when science, entertainment, art and morality collided. He discovers how the works of HG Wells, Aubrey Beardsley and Oscar Wilde were shaped by fears of moral, social and racial degeneration, and explains how Wilde sought to subvert traditional Victorian values

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Britain's northernmost station at Thurso in Caithness, Michael Portillo heads for the ferry port of Scrabster to cross the Pentland Firth to the Orkney Islands. programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: After an encounter with a school of migrating tuna, the Octonauts discover that one of the speedy fish, Tina, has been left behind. And she’s injured! Poor Tina has a hook stuck in her mouth and is too weak to swim. After Peso tends to her wound, the Octonauts agree to help get her to the tuna spawning grounds. But they’ll have to be quick: egg-laying season doesn’t last long. Luckily, Tweak’s latest gup, the Gup-R, is the fastest she’s ever built! The Octonauts use it to tow Tina, but when the Gup-R’s battery dies, how will they catch up to the rest of her school?

This episode is all about rain – drops of rain, trickly rain, pitter-patter rain, rainbow rain and really big splasher rain! We see Dee and a friend catching rain and spot Dee singing in the rain! The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dee’s friend finally succeeds in saying today’s word!

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies Theo, Dionne, Francis, Oliver, Minnie and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Nigel’s got some socks, a bib and a wooly hat inside his bag. All the parents and babies have different dressing-themed toys and objects too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to hide safe, baby-appropriate clothes or dressing-up toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, to explore with their baby. Some viewers show how they’ve been getting dressed at home too. The fun song We All Like Getting Dressed features, as does a story about Baby Bear dressing up in different outfits. The Action Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

programme.desc: Steve the palaeontologist tells us all about his fascinating dinosaur bone fossil that is 66 million years old!

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Carys wants to find out all about jellyfish in today’s episode. Chantelle visits an aquarium which is home to some rather special jellyfish, whilst Rory meets a marine expert and they head out to sea on a glass-bottomed boat Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help answer all of Carys's questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, jellyfish are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Chantelle and the children pretend to be jellyfish with colourful ribbons.

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: We meet five-year-old Henry and his family: Mummy, Mama, and little sister Sophie. There's lots of fun in store with a breakfast boogie and a visit to a farm. Back at home, they have some bouncy fun on the trampoline, and they find a tiny visitor in need of rescuing. But will they get the ladybird to safety?

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lola's family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lola's friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? There's a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

Meanwhile, Ayo and Sam are packing for a mission in the space capsule, but they can’t carry more than 2.5kg. Can they work out what to take so that their packs aren’t too heavy?

Hamza Yassin takes on legendary park keeper Ian Turner in a photography competition and tries to get some laughs out of the lions while Megan McCubbin helps with an experiment to provide fresh food all year round for the African colobus monkeys

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of Turner, one of Britain's most loved artists, Rick discovers how much the Cornish landscape influenced his work. At Newlyn Fish Market, he counts in the daily catch with the head auctioneer, who tells him how the market has adapted to modern times, while at Caerhays Castle, home to the nation's largest collection of magnolia plants, Rick discovers how this corner of Cornwall was once home to some of the great Victorian plant hunters

programme.desc: Sonali Shah explores Arundel in West Sussex, in her quest for the ideal location as her buyers seek the right place to spend their £900,000 on. She hands over the keys to some surprising houses, but will her self-confessed 'instant buyers' decide to seal the deal on any of them?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Expert Pete Woods meets John who brings in a trumpet that was gifted to him by his grandfather Frank who played it in an army band during the Second World War. John is hoping Pete can repair the instrument so he can start teaching his own grandson to play, the same way his grandad taught him. Claire brings in a delicately painted wardrobe given to her great grandparents to celebrate their marriage. Wood restorer Will Kirk tries to save the broken cupboard which is completely missing a back board and internal shelves. The final visitor to the barn is Jane who brings in a rickety old ironing board for the attention of Dominic Chinea that reminds her of the time her and her husband couldn't afford a home and lived in a squat

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.desc: On the banks of the River Tamar, Rick visits a little-known mausoleum with a rather macabre story and takes to the waves with an inspirational organisation who offer therapy using the power of surfing. On the wild Atlantic coast, near Bedruthan Steps, he meets fellow chef Emily Scott, who recreates the meal she cooked for President Joe Biden during the recent G7 summit

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits the seaside town of Ayr, combing through its good-looking property stock and popular culture haunts. With £400,000 in their pocket, her buyers have pinpointed Ayr as a potential perfect town because it puts them a walk from the beach and a train ride from the buzz of Glasgow. They soon discover it's a real gem of a place, with a multi-generational crowd thanks to its university campus and lively theatre scene, as well as award-winning local seafood on the waterfront

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Sisters Lauren and Claire bring Timmy the teddy bear into the barn with hopes that toy restorers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell can bring back his sparkle. Having been given to their late father Brian when he was born in the 1960s, the sisters want to give the toy to his grandson Harrison to keep his memory alive. Sukeshi brings in a watch given to her by her mother that symbolises her fight for her daughter to lead an independent life despite her disabilities. Horologist Steve Fletcher teams up with Kirsten Ramsay to try get the watch ticking again. The final visitors to the barn, Kegham and his daughter Karine, bring in a sporting trophy for the attention of silversmith Brenton West. Now aged 97, Kegham won the trophy in the 1950s when he was a part of a tennis club in Cyprus

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of the evening session on day five from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where Great Britain's Jake Wightman will hope to be in contention to defend his 1500m title at 8.15. The man from Nottingham produced a fine run in 2022 to beat Norway's Olympic champion Jakob Ingebritsen into second place. Finals also take place in the women's 400m at 8.35 and the men's 400m hurdles at 8.50, while the women's pole vault, which started earlier this evening also reaches a conclusion. With commentary by Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The celebrities are put into pairs and tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish which must be identical in both appearance and flavour but only one team member has the instructions and must communicate to get the job done. Then, it's out of the frying pan and into the fire as the contestants cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service for the first time in three years. Finally, in the all-new Food Truck Challenge the celebrities cook a dish they would serve from their own dream food truck in just one hour

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Sian Eleri's investigation into the reported haunting of Penyffordd Farm continues as multiple witnesses claim to see a hooded figure. Could they all have imagined the same thing? As she listens to recordings the original investigator made, Sian discovers the Welsh words for disabled and child had allegedly appeared on the walls. Sian meets with one of the Gower daughters to ask whether at the time she believed that to be the monk apparition focussing in one family member

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Unable to meet Rose-Mary or David, Sian Eleri visits an exorcist to find out what he believes removing a spirit from the house would entail. She speaks to the daughters of the couple that owned the house at the height of the haunting to question them one last time and Dr Daniels finds a similar case in Spain that might provide a clue as to how the haunting might have been a hoax

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Mark Draisey, a caricaturist who switched disciplines after 30 years to become a traditional portrait painter, creates the final image of the series, depicting hospital porter Holly. When her eight-year-old daughter Renae was diagnosed with a brain tumour, Holly was overwhelmed by the care and support her family received and wanted to give back to the service. After five years of remission, Renae has fully recovered and aspires to join the NHS as a midwife one day

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A Birmingham police officer is stabbed in the neck while trying to execute an arrest. In Hull an officer and his faithful police dog come under a violent attack

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: When a woman is the victim of an acid attack in Brighton, an expert pieces together hours of CCTV footage to identify the suspect. Plus, through a process of pollen analysis, an expert witness helps police solve a murder case

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood takes a walk on the wild side, working as a zookeeper at the largest zoo in the UK. As he mucks in, he discovers that the zoo's conservation efforts are helping make sure that many of these endangered species survive in the wild for generations to come

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin follow progress on ambitious projects to bring back to life a pair of semi-detached cottages in Churchtown in Lancashire and two developments in Kent - a tired end terrace in Dover and a purpose-built flat in Margate

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and experts Roo Irvine and Philip Serrell search for antiques in Wrexham, north Wales before heading to Lichfield, Staffordshire, for the auction. Natasha also discovers the history of St Giles Church

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A feud is brewing in the meerkat enclosure - and it's a family affair. To try to bring them together and allow them to work out their pecking order, keeper Charlie has a plan. Plus, a legendary lion turns 18. Presented by Ben Fogle, Kate Humble, Hamza Yassin and Megan McCubbin

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: In the town of Looe, Rick discovers a time when the Cornish were taken as slaves by Barbary Pirates. He joins one of the last fishing boats in St Mawes and uses the catch of lemon sole to make a delicious warm salad. In Newlyn, he meets two entrepreneur chefs who are cooking mackerel to perfection

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Steve Brown takes a couple round the West Yorkshire market town of Wetherby, showing them properties for their £550,000 budget and also exploring the local cafes and horticulture

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Ann and Lucy present a tiny metal table that's on its last legs. The table was made by Ann's grandfather Joseph over 100 years ago for her mother Dora when she was a little girl. Knowing they'd like the table to be robust enough to pass on to the next generation, silversmith Brenton West gets to work to put the wobbly-legged item on firmer footing once again. The experts also revive a 100-year-old shipping log charting the bravery of a seafarer during the Second World War

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey panics when she finds out someone has trashed her bedroom and Bobby enlists Peter's help in turning the chippy into a success so Kathy won't sell. Anton gives Yolande an ultimatum and Peter tries to stop the budding relationship between his siblings

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby orders Peter to leave and Cindy senses that something is wrong. Martin returns from Bulgaria and Stacey tries to keep the break-in a secret from him. Janet gets her GCSE results

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further live coverage of day six from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, featuring three finals on the track - the women's 100m hurdles at 8.25, the men's 400m at 8.35 and the women's 400m hurdles at 8.50. British record-holder Matthew Hudson-Smith claimed bronze in the 400m last year in Eugene, with USA's Michael Norman winning gold and Kirani James of Grenada taking silver

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-investigates the case of osteopath Danny Dyke. After the 30-year-old went missing in 1994, it was discovered that he was acting as a drug courier between London and Swansea. When his body was not found, he was presumed dead and a rumour quickly spread that he had been murdered. A remarkable chain of events led the police to a hillside near Swansea, where they located a fragment of bone that became key in the investigation

programme.title: The Good Liar (2019)
programme.desc: Con man Roy Courtnay sets his sights on the recently widowed Betty McLeish, who is worth millions. However, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with very high stakes. Director Bill Condon's crime thriller based on the novel by Nicholas Searle, starring Helen Mirren, Ian McKellen and Russell Tovey

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In London, a Met officer is attacked by a man with a four-foot-long broadsword and an officer in York uses all her strength and courage to rescue a colleague from an icy river

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A bio-archaeologist helps police investigate a body found in a lake and a virologist helps determine the guilt of a man accused of intentionally spreading HIV

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood finds out what it takes to fill the UK's freezers with peas, joining the harvest on a Yorkshire farm and helping at the factory where they are bagged and frozen

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits Sketty near Swansea to see a three-bed semi with original features and heads to Ilfracombe, North Devon to see a two-bedroom with a bad first impression. Tommy Walsh is in London on the Isle of dogs where a three bed flat has great development potential

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt are in Nottinghamshire to help two teams look for items of value at the Newark Antiques Fair. Presenter Charlie Ross gets the lowdown on the resurgence of brown furniture, before the whole team heads to Derby for some auction action

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers are matchmaking for Zuri the fennec fox who has been historically unlucky in love and take a big step forward in the antelope breeding programme. Hamza Yassin takes on legendary park keeper Ian Turner in a photography competition and tries to get some laughs out of the lions while Megan McCubbin helps with an experiment to provide fresh food all year round for the African colobus monkeys

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of Turner, one of Britain's most loved artists, Rick discovers how much the Cornish landscape influenced his work. At Newlyn Fish Market, he counts in the daily catch with the head auctioneer, who tells him how the market has adapted to modern times, while at Caerhays Castle, home to the nation's largest collection of magnolia plants, Rick discovers how this corner of Cornwall was once home to some of the great Victorian plant hunters

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah explores Arundel in West Sussex, in her quest for the ideal location as her buyers seek the right place to spend their £900,000 on. She hands over the keys to some surprising houses, but will her self-confessed 'instant buyers' decide to seal the deal on any of them?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Expert Pete Woods meets John who brings in a trumpet that was gifted to him by his grandfather Frank who played it in an army band during the Second World War. John is hoping Pete can repair the instrument so he can start teaching his own grandson to play, the same way his grandad taught him. Claire brings in a delicately painted wardrobe given to her great grandparents to celebrate their marriage. Wood restorer Will Kirk tries to save the broken cupboard which is completely missing a back board and internal shelves. The final visitor to the barn is Jane who brings in a rickety old ironing board for the attention of Dominic Chinea that reminds her of the time her and her husband couldn't afford a home and lived in a squat

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil gets serious with Alfie about his health and Suki worries that Eve isn't coping well after speaking to Caz. Anna tells her family about her plans to contact her mum and Bobby is shocked to learn Kathy is selling the chippy

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki and Stacey come together to help Eve but Theo's meddling doesn't help. Things go wrong for Patrick when Yolande's ex-lover Anton arrives and Phil continues to put pressure on Alfie. A familiar face returns to the square

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day four from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are awarded in the women's 1500m at 8.30 and the men's 3,000m steeplechase at 8.42. Great Britain's Laura Muir will be looking to build on her 1500m bronze medal at last year's championships in Eugene, while reigning world and Olympic title holder Soufiane El Bakkali could again be the man to beat in the steeplechase

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actors Amy Walsh and Michael Praed, rapper and philanthropist Apl.de.Ap, dancer Dianne Buswell and reality star Luca Bish compete in the final week of heats. Faced first with the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient to incorporate into a meal for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace before preparing their Dinner Party Dishes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: Roman Kemp presents a documentary following young footballers rejected by top clubs as they get a second chance through a unique camp at Manchester City's former training ground, under the watchful eye of former premier league player Gifton Noel-Williams. The first episode features a training match against Manchester International Football Academy

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Paralympic legend Hannah Cockroft, former Premier League striker Clinton Morrison, Great Britain sprinter Desiree Henry and sports broadcaster Nat Coombs join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Two officers in South Wales face a man with a 30cm long kitchen knife and a traffic officer in Leeds puts his life at risk to save a driver trapped in a van. Surrey Fire and Rescue respond to a huge wildfire

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A forensic biologist helps police find the murderer of a 21-year-old student who was found dumped in the Humber Estuary and an expert witness analyses the soil on a shallow grave to unearth the truth behind the death of a man in Scotland

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood joins the East Yorkshire bus company in Hull, getting behind the wheel of a double decker, making sure the vehicles go out on time and helping to keep them in perfect working order

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A trio of terraces are sold at auction in Derby, Crowland near Peterborough, and Clifton near Penrith in Cumbria. All of the developers are relatively new to the renovation game, but all are confident they can make a profit from their investments

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Christina Trevanion present from the Oswestry Showground, where the teams search for antiques with the help of Kate Bliss and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers introduce a new male to the pack in Wolf Wood and hope he takes to the new matriarch Meg when he arrives. Hamza Yassin uses his lens to attempt to identify the sexes of the most recent wallabies to arrive at the park and Megan McCubbin has her first close-up experience with an aardvark

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the banks of the River Tamar, Rick visits a little-known mausoleum with a rather macabre story and takes to the waves with an inspirational organisation who offer therapy using the power of surfing. On the wild Atlantic coast, near Bedruthan Steps, he meets fellow chef Emily Scott, who recreates the meal she cooked for President Joe Biden during the recent G7 summit

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits the seaside town of Ayr, combing through its good-looking property stock and popular culture haunts. With £400,000 in their pocket, her buyers have pinpointed Ayr as a potential perfect town because it puts them a walk from the beach and a train ride from the buzz of Glasgow. They soon discover it's a real gem of a place, with a multi-generational crowd thanks to its university campus and lively theatre scene, as well as award-winning local seafood on the waterfront

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Sisters Lauren and Claire bring Timmy the teddy bear into the barn with hopes that toy restorers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell can bring back his sparkle. Having been given to their late father Brian when he was born in the 1960s, the sisters want to give the toy to his grandson Harrison to keep his memory alive. Sukeshi brings in a watch given to her by her mother that symbolises her fight for her daughter to lead an independent life despite her disabilities. Horologist Steve Fletcher teams up with Kirsten Ramsay to try get the watch ticking again. The final visitors to the barn, Kegham and his daughter Karine, bring in a sporting trophy for the attention of silversmith Brenton West. Now aged 97, Kegham won the trophy in the 1950s when he was a part of a tennis club in Cyprus

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth
