programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil gets serious with Alfie about his health and Suki worries that Eve isn't coping well after speaking to Caz. Anna tells her family about her plans to contact her mum and Bobby is shocked to learn Kathy is selling the chippy

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki and Stacey come together to help Eve but Theo's meddling doesn't help. Things go wrong for Patrick when Yolande's ex-lover Anton arrives and Phil continues to put pressure on Alfie. A familiar face returns to the square

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Further live coverage of day four from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are awarded in the women's 1500m at 8.30 and the men's 3,000m steeplechase at 8.42. Great Britain's Laura Muir will be looking to build on her 1500m bronze medal at last year's championships in Eugene, while reigning world and Olympic title holder Soufiane El Bakkali could again be the man to beat in the steeplechase

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actors Amy Walsh and Michael Praed, rapper and philanthropist Apl.de.Ap, dancer Dianne Buswell and reality star Luca Bish compete in the final week of heats. Faced first with the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient to incorporate into a meal for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace before preparing their Dinner Party Dishes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: Roman Kemp presents a documentary following young footballers rejected by top clubs as they get a second chance through a unique camp at Manchester City's former training ground, under the watchful eye of former premier league player Gifton Noel-Williams. The first episode features a training match against Manchester International Football Academy

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Paralympic legend Hannah Cockroft, former Premier League striker Clinton Morrison, Great Britain sprinter Desiree Henry and sports broadcaster Nat Coombs join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Two officers in South Wales face a man with a 30cm long kitchen knife and a traffic officer in Leeds puts his life at risk to save a driver trapped in a van. Surrey Fire and Rescue respond to a huge wildfire

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A forensic biologist helps police find the murderer of a 21-year-old student who was found dumped in the Humber Estuary and an expert witness analyses the soil on a shallow grave to unearth the truth behind the death of a man in Scotland

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood joins the East Yorkshire bus company in Hull, getting behind the wheel of a double decker, making sure the vehicles go out on time and helping to keep them in perfect working order

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A trio of terraces are sold at auction in Derby, Crowland near Peterborough, and Clifton near Penrith in Cumbria. All of the developers are relatively new to the renovation game, but all are confident they can make a profit from their investments

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Christina Trevanion present from the Oswestry Showground, where the teams search for antiques with the help of Kate Bliss and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers introduce a new male to the pack in Wolf Wood and hope he takes to the new matriarch Meg when he arrives. Hamza Yassin uses his lens to attempt to identify the sexes of the most recent wallabies to arrive at the park and Megan McCubbin has her first close-up experience with an aardvark

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the banks of the River Tamar, Rick visits a little-known mausoleum with a rather macabre story and takes to the waves with an inspirational organisation who offer therapy using the power of surfing. On the wild Atlantic coast, near Bedruthan Steps, he meets fellow chef Emily Scott, who recreates the meal she cooked for President Joe Biden during the recent G7 summit

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits the seaside town of Ayr, combing through its good-looking property stock and popular culture haunts. With £400,000 in their pocket, her buyers have pinpointed Ayr as a potential perfect town because it puts them a walk from the beach and a train ride from the buzz of Glasgow. They soon discover it's a real gem of a place, with a multi-generational crowd thanks to its university campus and lively theatre scene, as well as award-winning local seafood on the waterfront

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Sisters Lauren and Claire bring Timmy the teddy bear into the barn with hopes that toy restorers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell can bring back his sparkle. Having been given to their late father Brian when he was born in the 1960s, the sisters want to give the toy to his grandson Harrison to keep his memory alive. Sukeshi brings in a watch given to her by her mother that symbolises her fight for her daughter to lead an independent life despite her disabilities. Horologist Steve Fletcher teams up with Kirsten Ramsay to try get the watch ticking again. The final visitors to the barn, Kegham and his daughter Karine, bring in a sporting trophy for the attention of silversmith Brenton West. Now aged 97, Kegham won the trophy in the 1950s when he was a part of a tennis club in Cyprus

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of the evening session on day five from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where Great Britain's Jake Wightman will hope to be in contention to defend his 1500m title at 8.15. The man from Nottingham produced a fine run in 2022 to beat Norway's Olympic champion Jakob Ingebritsen into second place. Finals also take place in the women's 400m at 8.35 and the men's 400m hurdles at 8.50, while the women's pole vault, which started earlier this evening also reaches a conclusion. With commentary by Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The celebrities are put into pairs and tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish which must be identical in both appearance and flavour but only one team member has the instructions and must communicate to get the job done. Then, it's out of the frying pan and into the fire as the contestants cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service for the first time in three years. Finally, in the all-new Food Truck Challenge the celebrities cook a dish they would serve from their own dream food truck in just one hour

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Sian Eleri's investigation into the reported haunting of Penyffordd Farm continues as multiple witnesses claim to see a hooded figure. Could they all have imagined the same thing? As she listens to recordings the original investigator made, Sian discovers the Welsh words for disabled and child had allegedly appeared on the walls. Sian meets with one of the Gower daughters to ask whether at the time she believed that to be the monk apparition focussing in one family member

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Unable to meet Rose-Mary or David, Sian Eleri visits an exorcist to find out what he believes removing a spirit from the house would entail. She speaks to the daughters of the couple that owned the house at the height of the haunting to question them one last time and Dr Daniels finds a similar case in Spain that might provide a clue as to how the haunting might have been a hoax

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Mark Draisey, a caricaturist who switched disciplines after 30 years to become a traditional portrait painter, creates the final image of the series, depicting hospital porter Holly. When her eight-year-old daughter Renae was diagnosed with a brain tumour, Holly was overwhelmed by the care and support her family received and wanted to give back to the service. After five years of remission, Renae has fully recovered and aspires to join the NHS as a midwife one day

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A Birmingham police officer is stabbed in the neck while trying to execute an arrest. In Hull an officer and his faithful police dog come under a violent attack

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: When a woman is the victim of an acid attack in Brighton, an expert pieces together hours of CCTV footage to identify the suspect. Plus, through a process of pollen analysis, an expert witness helps police solve a murder case

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood takes a walk on the wild side, working as a zookeeper at the largest zoo in the UK. As he mucks in, he discovers that the zoo's conservation efforts are helping make sure that many of these endangered species survive in the wild for generations to come

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin follow progress on ambitious projects to bring back to life a pair of semi-detached cottages in Churchtown in Lancashire and two developments in Kent - a tired end terrace in Dover and a purpose-built flat in Margate

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and experts Roo Irvine and Philip Serrell search for antiques in Wrexham, north Wales before heading to Lichfield, Staffordshire, for the auction. Natasha also discovers the history of St Giles Church

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A feud is brewing in the meerkat enclosure - and it's a family affair. To try to bring them together and allow them to work out their pecking order, keeper Charlie has a plan. Plus, a legendary lion turns 18. Presented by Ben Fogle, Kate Humble, Hamza Yassin and Megan McCubbin

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: In the town of Looe, Rick discovers a time when the Cornish were taken as slaves by Barbary Pirates. He joins one of the last fishing boats in St Mawes and uses the catch of lemon sole to make a delicious warm salad. In Newlyn, he meets two entrepreneur chefs who are cooking mackerel to perfection

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Steve Brown takes a couple round the West Yorkshire market town of Wetherby, showing them properties for their £550,000 budget and also exploring the local cafes and horticulture

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Ann and Lucy present a tiny metal table that's on its last legs. The table was made by Ann's grandfather Joseph over 100 years ago for her mother Dora when she was a little girl. Knowing they'd like the table to be robust enough to pass on to the next generation, silversmith Brenton West gets to work to put the wobbly-legged item on firmer footing once again. The experts also revive a 100-year-old shipping log charting the bravery of a seafarer during the Second World War

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey panics when she finds out someone has trashed her bedroom and Bobby enlists Peter's help in turning the chippy into a success so Kathy won't sell. Anton gives Yolande an ultimatum and Peter tries to stop the budding relationship between his siblings

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby orders Peter to leave and Cindy senses that something is wrong. Martin returns from Bulgaria and Stacey tries to keep the break-in a secret from him. Janet gets her GCSE results

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further live coverage of day six from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, featuring three finals on the track - the women's 100m hurdles at 8.25, the men's 400m at 8.35 and the women's 400m hurdles at 8.50. British record-holder Matthew Hudson-Smith claimed bronze in the 400m last year in Eugene, with USA's Michael Norman winning gold and Kirani James of Grenada taking silver

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Paddy Raff Show
programme.desc: More sketches featuring the popular stand-up comedian, showcasing his unique and quirky take on modern life. This episode comprises a compilation of the biggest belly-laughs from the series, the 2020 Christmas special and the original pilot show

programme.title: The Good Liar (2019)
programme.desc: Con man Roy Courtnay sets his sights on the recently widowed Betty McLeish, who is worth millions. However, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with very high stakes. Director Bill Condon's crime thriller based on the novel by Nicholas Searle, starring Helen Mirren, Ian McKellen and Russell Tovey

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Nannag a' Noo/Huggleboo
programme.desc: Huggleboo?is allowed to sleep over at?Zizou’s?place

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: When Hoppity is left in the garden, Flop and Bing have to go in search of him

programme.title: Lon le Linda
programme.desc: Margaret Mary and Aneirin help Linda make blackcurrant rice pudding, and learn about how blackcurrant juice is made

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: The animals play hide-and-seek, and this week's word is also able to find things that cannot be seen

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: The Wintry Games are great fun and it looks like Posy is the champion - but is there a secret to be told?

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Eoghan MacDonald reads Anns a' Ghàrradh Ghrinn Dhìomhair, written by Linda Sarah, illustrated by Fiona Lumbers and translated into Gaelic by Angela MacEachen

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich/Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
programme.desc: When Ronia is 10 years old, the now lively young girl is given permission to go out into the forest for the first time

programme.title: Bogaisean is Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles
programme.desc: When Troig and Glob get stuck together in a tyre, they have to work together in order to get out and to be friendly to one another. But how will they get on?

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: With all expedition members hospitalised, Tintin, Adag and Dìleas continue to search for Calcalas by going to Peru

programme.title: An Solas Buan (Lighthouses of Scotland)
programme.desc: The work of lighthouse architects David and Charles Stevenson, whose pragmatic and modern designs feature on a number of small unmanned lights. Examples of their work include designs at Rattray Head, Stroma, Bass Rock and the Brough of Birsay

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Joy Dunlop guides viewers through the first steps of speaking Gaelic

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA

programme.title: Na Tiristich (From Tiree with Love)
programme.desc: Tiree is approximately 12 miles long, five miles wide, and has a population of around 650. Cameras reveal what it is like to live on the most westerly island in the Inner Hebrides

programme.title: Iùl a' Chiùil (The Musical Path)
programme.desc: Exploring innovation in Irish and Scottish traditional music, charting the shifting sands between tradition and innovation over the past half -century and featuring some of the best new, cutting-edge acts including Zoe Conway and John McIntyre; Chris Stout and Catriona Mackay, and Rónán Ó Snodaigh

programme.title: Orain Oir
programme.desc: Delving into the Gaelic music archive to pick out the best performances through the decades

programme.title: An Lan - A' Tuigsinn an Lain/Tide - Understanding the Tide
programme.desc: How people harness the tide for different purposes, featuring a swimming challenge that uses the tide as a catapult. Plus, a look at tidal power technology on Orkney

programme.title: Bannan (The Ties That Bind)
programme.desc: Màiri is back to square one until she speaks to Peigi, who puts a new suspect in the frame - which rocks Màiri's world. Iain is sick of Anndra's games and is forced to tell Ciorstaidh the truth. Tormod and Raonaid regret the night before, and Donna and Finlay return from holiday to find their money problems have only just begun

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Rita is Crogall
programme.desc: Rita and Crocodile spend the night at granny’s house and use her telescope to look at the moon, the stars and all the planets in the Milky Way

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Ernest meets his old friend Léon, who he played music with when he was young. Léon insists that Ernest accompanies him on tour again, but what will Célestine do without Ernest?

programme.title: Stòiridh

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

An insight into the life of Eoghan Macdonald at the age of 12

programme.title: A-null 's a-nall
programme.desc: As an only child, Luis is used to doing a lot of fun activities with his parents. However, that all changes when they have another baby, a baby that is anything but fun in Luis' eyes and who would be better suited to another family. Short Gaelic films for younger viewers

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc: The CBBC ALBA presenters love a good challenge but who will emerge victorious as Rachel joins them?

programme.title: Proiseact Ploigh
programme.desc: Dr Moiteil and Professor Olive have fun with science in the company of the Lasgainean

programme.title: Clann a' Chogaidh Mhoir (Small Hands in a Big War)
programme.desc: Children's stories about the First World War, featuring the tale of a 13-year-old Flemish girl who was severely punished by a German officer for stealing some potatoes. Fleeing her home, she crossed an electric fence on the Belgian border to raise money to save her family from the crippling fines they had to pay on her behalf

programme.title: Dàn
programme.desc: Eilidh Cormack discusses and reads the poem Thig Trì Nithean Gun Iarraidh by the Daughter of the Laird of Rèilig. She speaks about how its messages are still relevant today

programme.title: SpeakGaelic

programme.title: Jock Stein
programme.desc: Documentary profiling the legendary football manager, who escaped a life in the coal mines for a sporting career that included a hugely successful spell as Celtic's coach

programme.title: Mach à Seo!
programme.desc: Ramsay MacMahon travels to Stirlingshire for an action-packed few days. He climbs to the top of the Wallace Monument for panoramic views of the countryside and Stirling Castle

programme.title: Sgeulachd nam Pola/The Poles Revealed
programme.desc: Science documentary taking viewers on a journey of discovery in the Arctic and Antarctic and revealing just how different these two landscapes are

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum Maclean swims in the River Etive, the water Calum claims is the most fun for a swimmer. Running between Glencoe to the sea, the river is full of amazing pools

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James visits the Shetland Islands, an area of natural beauty that he's always wanted to see. He gets to hire a vintage car to explore the area, where he learns about traditional fish salting and cooks a tasty vegetable curry at a local social enterprise project. Later on, James learns all about Shetland community spirit and cake at one of their famous Sunday teas, and finally cooks up a Shetland-inspired paella on a beautiful local beach

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: The fast-paced game of words hosted by Adil Ray. Pitting their wits today are Rebecca and mum Anne from Lancaster, mates Gareth and Frank from the West Midlands, and couple Rahul and Manny from Derby and London

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as James, Gareth, Adebola and Beth pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Great British Escape
programme.desc: In a new six-part series, Paul O'Grady shares the beautiful sights, stories and secrets of his beloved adopted home county, Kent. This time, Paul hops on the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch Railway, a beautiful miniature steam train that runs along the picturesque Kent coastline. Arriving in Dungeness, Paul heads to the RSPB nature reserve, before travelling to Dungeness beach, the largest expanse of shingle anywhere in Europe. Finally, Paul heads inland to the heart of the Romney Marshes, where he meets another unexpected local resident - a unlikely herd of alpacas

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team turn a suburban plot in Hull into a wildlife retreat for a nature-loving teenager and his family. Plus, tips on creating a pond that is attractive to animals and safe for children, the best small trees to screen an overlooked garden, and a guide putting together an outdoor cinema

programme.desc: Sleep deprivation is affecting work productivity and is said to be costing the country billions, with one in three reportedly suffering from insomnia, and sleep apnoea now affecting one-and-a-half million people. Rachel Townsend examines why so many people have trouble sleeping, and talks to experts and campaigners urging the government to act

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Storm Eunice wreaks havoc at Heathrow airport, as staff deal with a deluge of delays and unhappy passengers, and also try to deter debris from hitting the runway. Elsewhere, passenger experience manager Harry has to deal with a breach of security that affects hundreds of passengers jetting off on holiday

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Rampage
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Powerhouse Hobbs, Claudio Castagnoli, Ricky Starks and Jade Cargill, as well as many more athletes who bringing a freshness and energy into professional wrestling

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Kerry Godliman, Kojo Anim, Jimmy James Jones and Humza Arshad join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Judi Love on the panel show, and take viewers on an educational and tongue-in-cheek tour of Black British history. Hosted by Jimmy Akingbola

programme.title: Starstruck

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot

programme.title: The Confessions of Frannie Langton
programme.desc: In 1826, previously enslaved young woman Frannie Langton is brought from Jamaica and sent into service in the home of wealthy Londoners George and Marguerite Bentham. But when the couple are found stabbed to death, the maid finds herself accused of murder. Drama, starring Karla-Simone Spence, Sophie Cookson and Stephen Campbell Moore

programme.title: Diana's Decades
programme.desc: Princess Diana began the 1980s a shy bride and ended the decade the most photographed woman in the world. From Dynasty Di to Pop Princess to Aids champion, Diana harnessed and embodied the spirit of the 80s. As the world screamed 'Greed is Good', Diana found her voice and championed those left behind, and became, in the words of Vanity Fair's Tina Brown, 'the mouse that roared'

programme.desc: The emotional experience of delivering a baby together helps to reconcile Peggy and Ruth, while Vic learns the reason behind Stephen leaving university. Elsewhere, Mary Cooper causes chaos when she gets behind the wheel of a car. Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Thomas Craig star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A nurse with her head full of new ideas joins the ranks, ruffling Peggy and Ruth's feathers, while Stephen's barely got his feet back under his mum's table before he's drawn into a steamy love triangle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is shocked to discover a severed hand in a dustbin and the subsequent police investigation unearths evidence which suggests someone on Lord Ashfordly's estate may be responsible. Meanwhile, Peggy invests in a freezer for her latest business venture, but soon finds her new purchase at the centre of the murder case. Last in series, starring Tricia Penrose, Gwen Taylor and Jonathan Kerrigan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An infamous London gangster arrives in the area to try to rebuild his life after prison, but Sergeant Miller has other ideas. Meanwhile, Peg starts a salmonella outbreak in Aidensfield when her miracle chicken feed scam goes awry

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack is asked to investigate the theft of a car belonging to a friend of Mullett, but misjudges the grizzled Superintendent's capacity for tact and diplomacy and it is not long before he is taken off the case. Things take a shocking turn when the car finally turns up - with the body of a drug dealer in the boot. Detective drama, starring David Jason, with Melanie Thaw and Bruce Alexander

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf poses as a criminal as part of an undercover operation, but his covert actions only reveal startling information about Miller's ethical beliefs. David eyes up Peggy's room when she applies to be Lord Ashfordly's housekeeper - but both are left disappointed when the interview is a complete failure. Rural drama, starring William Simons, John Duttine, David Stockwell and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of youths push Peggy down a hole while she's poaching. Lord Ashfordly alerts Miller, who gives chase - but lands himself in trouble when he knocks down an elderly pedestrian. However, the incident gives Peggy a new money-making idea - she'll sue for the 'injury' she sustained in the fall. Meanwhile, Gina is attracted to her handsome college tutor. Tim Brooke-Taylor and Murray Head guest star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. As DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new forensic pathologist Kam Karimore investigate the mysterious crime, they find themselves drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching during their quest to identify the perpetrator. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Helen Baxendale and Navin Chowdhry

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: While working with the drug squad, Ronnie and Joe find a skeleton that has been hidden inside the boot of a car in the River Thames. It turns out to be the remains of Taylor Kane, an undercover policeman who went missing in the 1980s - around the time of the Brixton riots. Through clever detection, unsettling evidence is unearthed and the team knows it must raise issues the police would rather forget. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, and featuring one of the last performances by Roger Lloyd-Pack, who died in January

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: With Lizzie still on the run, Sarah finally persuades her boss, DCI Tim Bailie, to go public about Lizzie's disappearance. Meanwhile, the station is turned upside down in the hunt for a missing lottery ticket. David Jason, Michael McKell and Bruce Alexander star

Laurence Fox and Rebecca Front co-star alongside Kevin Whately

programme.desc: The hunt for the killer of a seemingly innocent family man brings Ronnie into contact with his old boss, former DI Natalie Chandler, whose father is accused of the crime. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, with Harriet Walter, Martin Jarvis and Roy Hudd

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The investigation of a burglary at a quarry turns into something far more serious when a security guard's badly beaten body is discovered at the scene of the crime. An autistic teenager is arrested for the murder, despite Inspector Frost's misgivings - a move which triggers a chain of tragic events culminating in a tense stand-off. Crime drama, starring David Jason, Bruce Alexander, Caroline Harker and Maurice Roeves

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The folk of Aidensfield panic when rumours of an escaped killer are confirmed. Rob attempts to track down the fugitive, but his investigations are complicated when Helen gets caught up in the case. David is left reeling when Greengrass's lurcher Alfred becomes seriously ill, and Peggy speaks to bereavement expert Bernie in the hope that he can lend support to the devastated handyman. Rural drama with David Stockwell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A priceless Manet painting is stolen from a retired German art dealer's home, leaving Miller to suspect Lord Ashfordly's involvement. Peggy tries to convince a pair of visiting bird-watchers that Aidensfield's wildlife includes a rare bird of prey, and David tries to wing it as an ornithological expert. Rural drama, starring Rupert Vansittart, John Duttine, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called to the University of Northumberland when Jamie Marshall, a promising young journalism student, falls to his death from the top of a disused faculty building. With no eyewitnesses and no immediate leads, Vera turns to friends and family to glean all she can about Jamie, and to discover who might have wanted him dead. The student's innocent facade is revealed to have concealed simmering resentment and anger which he expressed on the internet - and which may have made him some deadly enemies

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When the body of an elderly woman is discovered at a well-known suicide spot, Ronnie soon detects foul play, with suspicion falling on the victim's son and daughter-in-law, as well as a doctor who has recently arrived in the UK. However, even after a confession is secured, Joe remains baffled as to the motive, and Kate struggles to remain professional - jeopardising her career and leaving Jake to prosecute the case alone. Guest starring Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A blood-spattered hotel room and a stolen credit card lead Ronnie and Joe to Charles Hutton, a member of the wealthy upper classes who dotes on his wife Camille and daughter Georgia. The detectives find clues that suggest Georgia gave birth at the scene, but where is the baby now? The young woman and her boyfriend Rufus prove difficult for Jake and Kate to prosecute, and to make matters worse, the defence counsel turns out to be Jake's old nemesis. As the evidence stacks up, how far will Charles go to protect his privileged family? Guest starring James Wilby and Joseph Millson

Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A sergeant is injured in a shooting incident and names his informant as the person responsible. However, the suspected man's girlfriend insists that the officer is corrupt and steals away to be with her lover, who has gone into hiding. Lynda La Plante guest stars

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur and Ray live it up in Australia, spending money like there's no tomorrow _ but they face tough opposition for the Daley inheritance. Drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team has been given just two days and a 20 thousand dollar budget to remove a 10-metre steel-hulled yacht from Cockburn Beach in Western Australia. Finding his skills and knowledge tested to the limit, he encounters one of his oldest adversaries and discovers how a species can adapt its behaviour to survive

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jeremy Wade hears stories of corpses in the waters at some of America's tourist hotspots, and travels to one of the country's largest dams to uncover the truth. He also visits Florida to investigate more tales of fatal attacks in its waterways

programme.title: Passenger 57 (1992)
programme.desc: After his wife is shot dead during a robbery, a cop hands in his badge and takes up a job offer from an old friend to be a security adviser for a major transatlantic airline. programme.title: Magnum, PI

programme.desc: A security guard is murdered during a payroll snatch, and Regan and Carter are called in to support local investigating officers. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. They finally find the perfect place... but then they forget to take gravity into account.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.desc: Mr. Bean is charged with keeping an eye on Irma's dog Mopsy, but Mopsy is a very wilful pooch! Who is really in charge of who?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean crashes his mini into a pool of slurry and is desperate to get himself and his car - and poor Teddy - clean again!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam and Mo are at the end of their tether - Amber, who happens to be their neighbour, wakes them up every morning singing her salutation to the sun. They're used to it, but now it's worse ever since she got involved in the upcoming 'Musi-Botanical Space' in the Town Square, and there's no limit to her singing! When she bursts into song in the middle of the night and prevents any sleep, Mo and Sam break down and together invoke the power to control people's voices!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. To please Stella, Mo summons the power to have the 'Gorgeous' filter that Lenny has on his smartphone in real life - this means that he gets wind in his hair, an ultra-bright smile, and a slight yet flattering soft-focus effect applied to him permanently, but when at half-power, Mo ends up with an 'Animal Ears' filter instead! He is in despair, but Sam is delighted - thanks to her squirrel ears, she gains the trust of animals and enjoys magical experiences in the park!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated
programme.desc: A mummified corpse threatens a theatre production, prompting director Vincent van Ghoul to draft in the gang

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Scooby Dooby Doo takes the gang to meet his good friend, Lucy Liu, at her art gallery in Queens. She has a large art studio above the gallery that she uses to paint and sculpt.

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Porky and Daffy climb Mt. Neverest / Sylvester tries to catch Tweety in his nest on top of a telephone pole. / Wile E. Coyote tries to catch Road Runner with the help of a street sign.

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: In the series premiere episode, Daffy and Porky Pig ride through the jungle searching for treasures hidden and protected in the Temple of the Monkeybird. / In the first of a series of shorts, Marvin the Martian lands on a new planet and plants his flag, claiming the planet 'in the name of Mars.' However, each time Marvin plants the flag, something new and unexpected happens. / When Yosemite Sam brags about his arm-wrestling skills around town, Bugs Bunny becomes his challenger

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. The three boys adore John Savage, an explorer who films his TV show in incredibly hostile environments, and they think that it would so cool to be like him. It's time to test their mettle, so they head to the forest for a bit of wild camping that they won't forget any time soon... and especially since they run into the real John Savage when he's completely lost and nothing like Indiana Jones.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. It's a miracle - Flavio Tamaley, a big football star, has just arrived in front of the boys' building! Our trio hit it off with him and end up spending the day together with them, and JP sees it as an opportunity to become popular and tells all the kids in Bamboozle, Now our heroes want to be seen in Flavio's company instead of enjoying their time with the star, but a scandal threatens to ruin things...

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother who look to solve police investigations. Clever tells Bro and McFlare that she has gathered enough clues to know where the Evil Knight, the most wanted criminal in the animal kingdom, plans to hold the upcoming meeting of his secret organisation The Cause. The three detectives go there undercover, but they are unmasked when McFlare makes a clumsy move...

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls

The pair then make their way to Saltaire, the village built by the Victorian industrialist Titus Salt for his workers, before their final stop at the the Cow and Calf Rocks on Ilkley Moor

programme.title: Crocodile Tears: The Murder of Caroline Crouch
programme.desc: The story of Caroline Crouch, a British woman in Greece who was found dead on her bed beside her alive 11-month-old baby girl. Caroline had been killed in the early hours of the morning at her home in a wealthy suburb of Athens, suffocated as she slept. Her husband told the police she was killed by a gang of foreign burglars who broke into their home and tied them both up. However, what appeared to be an idyllic life between Caroline and her husband was revealed to be far darker as she feared him and had been looking for somewhere else to live days before her murder

Later, she visits the Lizard Peninsula, an area of outstanding natural beauty that as well as its unique landscape boasts a number of gems, including Cornish sea salt, Hevva Cake and Huer Huts. programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Luxury heritage train The Northern Belle, aka steam locomotive 6201 Princess Elizabeth, travels through England's rural north-west. Beginning in Preston, the passengers of its stylish 1930s Pullman carriages are soon whisked up through Cumbria and the spectacular landscapes of the Lake District. The train continues on to historic Carlisle, the site of a world-class medieval cathedral and home to supposedly England's most haunted station. It then joins the Settle to Carlisle line, considered one of the most scenic railway routes in the world

programme.title: The 1970s Supermarket
programme.desc: The story of the shopping revolution, as Britain went from small behind-the-counter shops to massive megastores, this time focusing on the mid-1970s. The episode reveals how, with package holidays in full swing, British consumers everywhere were falling in love with foreign food, from lasagna and beef bourguignon through to kebabs and curry. The programme also looks at how Marks and Spencer introduced the ready-made chicken Kiev, and how the supermarkets started creating their own booze departments in response to growing customer demand

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Trauma team leader Julie Norton battles to save two patients whose lives hang in the balance. programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bill Nighy narrates the stories of epic train journeys through stunning scenery and natural beauty, beginning with a trip from Inverness to Edinburgh. Not long after setting out, the route passes Culloden, the site of the last pitched battle on British soil. It then enters the Cairngorms National Park, home to some of Europe's finest landscapes as well as valleys steeped in Gaelic folklore. The park's station at Aviemore is home to the Strathspey Railway, where Victorian steam locomotives come to life. There is then a climb to the highest point on Britain's railway network before the train winds its way through Fife. Eventually the route crosses the Forth Bridge before arriving in Scottish capital Edinburgh, admired for its architecture and annual arts festival. Narrated by Bill Nighy

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)

Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee, and starring Emma Thompson (who also wrote the screenplay), Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant

programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

programme.title: Oliver! (1968)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: Con Air (1997)
programme.desc: Honourably discharged Army Ranger sergeant Cameron Poe hitches a ride home on a maximum-security flight conveying some of America's deadliest criminals. When they hijack the plane in mid-flight, led by criminal mastermind Cyrus the Virus, Poe is forced to intervene. Meanwhile, US marshal Vince Larkin has an ongoing battle on the ground to prevent the plane from being blown to pieces. Director Simon West's blockbusting action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi, Ving Rhames and Colm Meaney

programme.title: Coming to America (1988)
programme.desc: A bored African prince defies his father's plans for an arranged marriage and escapes to the USA to find a bride on his own terms. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall in several roles, with James Earl Jones, Allison Dean, Eriq La Salle and Madge Sinclair

programme.title: Brick Lane (2007)
programme.desc: A Bangladeshi woman reluctantly leaves her native country for an arranged marriage in England. Years spent living in a drab east-London tower block take their toll, while her husband is consumed by his thwarted ambitions. However, an encounter with a cocky younger man changes her outlook on life. Drama, based on Monica Ali's novel, starring Tannishtha Chatterjee and Satish Kaushik

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie (2004)
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptune's crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: Charlotte's Web (2006)
programme.desc: Youngster Fern tries to persuade her father to keep the runt of a litter when a sow gives birth to piglets on the family farm. While the little pig still looks destined for the chop, clever spider Charlotte hatches a plan to use her web-spinning talents to save him. Family drama, starring Dakota Fanning and featuring the voices of Julia Roberts, Dominic Scott Kay, Steve Buscemi and John Cleese

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2014)
programme.desc: A reporter discovers four humanoid amphibians who live in the sewers of New York, and use their martial arts skills to fight crime. She helps them as they face their toughest challenge yet - defeating a sinister criminal organisation that seems to have power over the entire city. Fantasy adventure, starring Megan Fox and William Fichtner, with the voice of Johnny Knoxville

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief (2010)
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan

programme.title: I, Robot (2004)
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

Action thriller based on Lee Child's series of novels, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Deadpool (2016)
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin

programme.title: Lynch/Oz (2022)
programme.desc: Alexandre O'Philippe's documentary about David Lynch looks to pull back the curtain on the influence that 1939's The Wizard of Oz starring Judy Garland has had upon the director's visionary work. The film is constructed from six visual essays by David Lowery, Karyn Kusama, John Waters, Rodney Ascher, Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead, and critic Amy Nicholson

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From Jabajak in Carmarthenshire, Wales, where sisters Lorraine Lloyd and Amanda Stuart-Robson host in their vineyard and restaurant B&B. The guests are stunned by the surroundings, and businessman Les Woollends and his head chef Lesz Zajac are convinced the sister act have the wow factor

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Les Woollends and his head chef Lesz Zajak welcome the contestants to the Clarendon Royal Hotel in Gravesend, Kent. The guests are dazzled on arrival, but Lesley Miller believes the champagne, truffles and fruit bowl are a ploy to win her over. The quality of the food gets good reviews at breakfast, although the guests poke fun at the crockery, and at feedback time criticism comes from an unexpected source and leaves the owner reconsidering his views of his rivals

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It

Gareth and Tina have owned the property for 10 years and Tina loves being within walking distance of work, schools, clubs and all the sights, but Gareth wants a big family home and Phil finds a detached house with a pool to tempt the family into the suburbs

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Young Moellendorff rat snake Sen is about to face male Jakob on her first ever date. But with snakes often eating the other one for dinner, will he be hungry for love or just hungry? The keepers are concerned about the health of orangutan Sarikei and Rothschild's giraffe Dagmar - both of whom have youngsters to care for - an otter pup is struggling to eat and struggling to walk

programme.title: The Dog House Australia

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: For most people, living in a lighthouse is pure fantasy. Not so for Edward and Hazel Short and their two young daughters. Back in 2012, they set out to build a brand new, art deco, shining white lighthouse tower with additional bedrooms, guest rooms, and infinity pool on the side - all on a rugged but beautiful clifftop in North Devon. Kevin McCloud sees if they made that dream a reality

programme.title: Titanic: Building the World's Largest Ship
programme.desc: The untold story of the doomed steamship's construction, revealing how 15,000 men toiled day and night in life-threatening conditions to create a state-of-the-art floating city. Based on original blueprints and unseen archives, cutting-edge special effects bring this process back to life on screen, and explore how the outsize ambitions that made it all possible also led to the ship's dramatic demise

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The Aberdeen trauma team are dispatched by air to 52-year-old Mark, who is trapped after crashing and rolling his van into farmland. In Inverclyde, nine-year-old David has been thrown 50 yards off his quad bike and impaled onto a metal fence, while 59-year-old Jacqui is rushed to the Queen Elizabeth Major Trauma Centre with multiple injuries after her car fell 10 feet down an embankment

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: The Emergency Ward

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

The hosts receive largely positive feedback from their guests, but Millie Bussey manages to find some flaws

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Olliers from Stenhousemuir in Scotland, where husband and wife Steven and Mhairi are undecided whether to sell their home or renovate it. Kirstie produces a plan that revolutionises the whole house, while Phil is tasked to find them a home that's a short throw away from their beloved cricket club

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Thirty seven-year-old elephant Thi is pregnant for the ninth time but the keepers believe she is now three months' overdue. The risks for Thi and her unborn calf are growing by the day, and the staff are worried. Rampant male Rothschild giraffe Meru causes problems for the giraffe herd as he relentlessly chases the females, and male clownfish Polo gets injured while fighting with the other males for the attentions of dominant female Rosie. However, clownfish can change sex at will, and Polo's time alone in an isolation tank produces a surprising side effect

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Amy and Kunal hope that getting a dog will help their son Arnav get his spark back. When they meet Lane, a dachshund cross puppy, Arnav falls in love but his parents aren't so sure

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin revisits traditional builder Paul and his wife Carol who, back in 2015, set out to create a bold, fortress-like home on the southern edge of the West Pennine Moors in Bolton

programme.title: The Duchess and Her Magical Kingdom
programme.desc: Jane Percy, the Duchess of Northumberland, builds the fairy-tale village of her dreams on the grounds of Alnwick Castle. She tours the castle and shares her visions of the village Lilidorei which include the world's largest play structure, nine different clan houses and a hobgoblin prison but things go wrong when builders discover an ancient culvert on the site of the build and the ramifications ramp up the budget by £13million

programme.title: The Royals: A History of Scandals
programme.desc: Professor Suzannah Lipscomb looks at a history of royal scandal, exploring the roles the press, parliament and public have played over the centuries. The first episode focuses on stories of out-of-control spending, from Henry VIII's Field of Cloth of Gold to the extraordinary debt that George IV accrued

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Young parents Nicole and Stefian arrive in resus with their 19-month-old daughter Xah'Nae, who is unresponsive and has a high fever, and doctors fear she may have a life-threatening infection. Meanwhile, the team suspects 61-year-old Christine has suffered a second stroke in 10 years, and 52-year-old Graham, who has Down's syndrome, is brought into A&E by his sisters following an accident

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal, Kent, where owner Michael Prime is joined by his mum Lorna. On arrival, Marianne Abben and Fran Birch love the seaside-inspired room, but entrepreneur Mark Genders is far from thrilled by the 'no frills' experience. Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Tuck family in Long Eaton, Derbyshire, who have grown weary of their cramped, three bedroom semi-detached home. Kirstie offers her thoughts on ways the family could change the downstairs of the property, while Phil sets out to find a suitable house they could buy instead

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chimp Zee Zee gives birth to a daughter and keepers hope her arrival will have a calming influence on the others. Meanwhile, chameleon Mr Parsons is set up with a young female, banteng mother Naya struggles to bond with her newly born calf, and elephant Nadita should be looking after baby Anjan, but would rather play with her boisterous cousin, Aayu

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Emily hopes that bringing a dog into the family home will provide a calming influence for her neurodiverse son Jacob. Digger the Jack Russell is suspected of being ideal emotional support for young Harper

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets actor Sean Simons, who has bought the ruins of Cloontykilla Castle in Co Roscommon with a view to using them to create a spectacular mock 16th-century home. However, the outlandish plans - including Jacuzzis in the battlements and water-spouting gargoyles - have Kevin worried the project could become a garish nightmare, and his scepticism increases when he realises Sean has not consulted an architect. Disaster seems to be looming as the contractors grow frustrated and planning regulations are ignored, but somehow things slowly begin to take shape - until a national economic crisis plunges everything into chaos

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Metal worker John Lloyd search for his own, affordable home has led him to floating homes on the Medway in Kent. John has spent almost all of his funds on a boat that is going to need a lot of work, from rotting timber to a total refurb. His father Pete helps out, as their combined skills with repurposing and reclaiming prove that almost anything is possible

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Having spent two years scouring Australia for the perfect plot, Catherine and Mick settle on 50 acres atop the spectacular rolling hills of South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula. They begin building a remarkable structure that looks more like a corrugated iron shed than a house

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Bill, 92, arrives at King's with breathing difficulties and a swollen leg and test results suggest there may be something seriously wrong, while 25-year-old Sarah is finding it hard to stand up and has been brought in by her mum and grandfather. She has learning difficulties as a result of an inherited genetic disorder and doctors are concerned she may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear

Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Tuck family in Long Eaton, Derbyshire, who have grown weary of their cramped, three bedroom semi-detached home. Kirstie offers her thoughts on ways the family could change the downstairs of the property, while Phil sets out to find a suitable house they could buy instead

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chimp Zee Zee gives birth to a daughter and keepers hope her arrival will have a calming influence on the others. Meanwhile, chameleon Mr Parsons is set up with a young female, banteng mother Naya struggles to bond with her newly born calf, and elephant Nadita should be looking after baby Anjan, but would rather play with her boisterous cousin, Aayu

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Emily hopes that bringing a dog into the family home will provide a calming influence for her neurodiverse son Jacob. Digger the Jack Russell is suspected of being ideal emotional support for young Harper

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets actor Sean Simons, who has bought the ruins of Cloontykilla Castle in Co Roscommon with a view to using them to create a spectacular mock 16th-century home. However, the outlandish plans - including Jacuzzis in the battlements and water-spouting gargoyles - have Kevin worried the project could become a garish nightmare, and his scepticism increases when he realises Sean has not consulted an architect. Disaster seems to be looming as the contractors grow frustrated and planning regulations are ignored, but somehow things slowly begin to take shape - until a national economic crisis plunges everything into chaos

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Metal worker John Lloyd search for his own, affordable home has led him to floating homes on the Medway in Kent. John has spent almost all of his funds on a boat that is going to need a lot of work, from rotting timber to a total refurb. His father Pete helps out, as their combined skills with repurposing and reclaiming prove that almost anything is possible

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Having spent two years scouring Australia for the perfect plot, Catherine and Mick settle on 50 acres atop the spectacular rolling hills of South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula. They begin building a remarkable structure that looks more like a corrugated iron shed than a house

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Bill, 92, arrives at King's with breathing difficulties and a swollen leg and test results suggest there may be something seriously wrong, while 25-year-old Sarah is finding it hard to stand up and has been brought in by her mum and grandfather. She has learning difficulties as a result of an inherited genetic disorder and doctors are concerned she may have suffered a stroke

programme.desc: Businessman Ken Brown hosts the final dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to entertain his guests with a 'wear a wig' themed evening. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Jane find a holiday home with a sea view on the Portuguese island of Madeira on a budget of £200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman tries to help Dave and Debbie Gough from Swindon, who have been holidaying on the Costa Blanca for 30 years and now want to retire there

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a memorable restoration project in the remote Creuse region of central France. Back in 2003, when Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs gave up everything in the UK to start a new life abroad, they couldn't have known what was ahead of them. Falling in love with a dilapidated manor house with just four crumbling walls and half a roof, they embarked on a mission to transform it - working day and night, doing everything themselves, year after year - until slowly but surely they created a magnificent edifice out of the ruins they bought off the internet. On the 70th anniversary of the destruction of the original 19th-century building by the German army, the house finally took its finished form

programme.title: A Cotswold Farmshop

programme.desc: In the quarter final, the five remaining teams create 24 savoury puff pastries and three sharing-sized brioche feuilletée in just three and a half hours. programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt visits the heart of Texas to help out a retired couple who run a pecan farm. He then travels north and reaches Fort Worth just in time for the world's oldest rodeo and stock show where farmers from 42 states bring their cows, goats, horses and other livestock with hopes of winning a big prize. Matt then heads back into the countryside as he meets one of the state's newest farmers, along with the donkeys and cattle that are helping him become a social media star

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, including Nick and Liv Grimshaw, Rylan and his mother Linda, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Micah Richards and Jamie Carragher, Martin and Roman Kemp, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aléshé and Mel C and her brother Paul, turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on Stranger Things, This Is MY House, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, For Soccer Aid, The Savoy, Million Pound Pawn, Romeo and Duet, and BBC News reporting on the demise of Neighbours

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Traitors, Gino's Cooking up Love, Lady Chatterley's Lover, I Can See Your Voice, Blowing LA, This Morning and White Christmas

programme.title: Top Guns: Inside the RAF
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes - and in the cockpit - with the personnel at RAF Lossiemouth, as global tensions, including with Russia, impact on missions both at home and abroad. In the first episode, RAF pilot Jake Desmond is sent to NATO's frontline to face off against three Russian jets, and rookie pilot Harry Brooks tries to earn his wings and qualify for live operations

programme.title: Emergency
programme.desc: At King's College Hospital, specialist surgeons need to work quickly to save the foot of 87-year-old June who suffered a severe open ankle fracture when she lost her balance stepping into a taxi. After being involved in a high-speed crash on the M25, Karl is in intensive care being kept alive by a ventilator. At St Mary's, Zoltan prepares to see his children for the first time after his partial leg amputation and 20-year-old motorcyclist Daniil arrives at St George's by air ambulance after a collision with an HGV

programme.title: Emergency
programme.desc: Ex-soldier Joe visits St Mary's Major Trauma Centre after getting drunk at an army reunion and falling down an escalator, leaving him with a fractured skull and a bleed in his brain. A 25-year-old is treated for a severe femur injury after being tackled and 46-year-old Jorge is brought in to North Middlesex University Hospital after being found unconscious with a lot of bleeding

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of ex-advertising man Geoff, who is selling his luxury villa in Spain and moving into a caravan while he project manages the construction of a dramatically cantilevered steel-framed house on the Essex coast, costing a total of £700,000. But after the anchoring steel has been drilled into the ground, he runs into the double trouble - Covid-19 and a collapse in the Spanish property market. Will he ever finish this complicated - and expensive - construction?

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary recording daily life inside Woodgreen animal charity. The team continues with its mission to find homes for abandoned dogs. Plus, a young driver makes a mistake she may come to regret

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: PC Damo Stevens takes on an aggressive arsonist intent on bringing Darlington to a standstill, while dog handler Andy Hunt is called to a violent domestic disturbance. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team are outnumbered and outmuscled when they stop a coach-load of cage fighters following an anonymous tip off that there may be drugs on board. Graeme meets Carol and Peter who recently took home two female puppies from the same litter. The couple hoped that the young pups would be the perfect addition to their lives, but their dream has turned into a nightmare as they appear to have extreme and ferocious sibling rivalry. Elsewhere, Graeme catches up with Diego, a seemingly-aggressive Rottweiler cross that had been rescued as a pup to see if his problem behaviour is still an issue for owner Andrea and her family

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Marilyn is invited to join the CEO of Stunning Organics on the podium at a press conference, with explosive results. Elsewhere, Tegan empathises with Andrew

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine suspected of murdering a girl is killed in Iraq, and a search of his personal belongings reveals her body. Most members of the team believe they have found conclusive evidence of his guilt - but Gibbs suspects there is more to the situation than meets the eye

programme.desc: The admissions director of an exclusive Manhattan elementary school is bludgeoned to death and Briscoe and Green initially believe she was murdered by a parent determined to have their child enrolled. However, as their investigation continues, a member of the school's staff comes under suspicion. Guest starring Roger Rees, with Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the death of a Russian model, and when the autopsy reveals a host of old injuries they suspect long-term abuse. Further tests are made on the body, and the findings suggest medical malpractice may have been the cause, leading the detectives to track down the person responsible for her death. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Four murders occur in Manhattan, all of which seem to have been committed by the same sniper. Although the shootings appear random, Briscoe and Green suspect the deaths are linked and discover a connection between one of the victims and a former marine who is an expert shot with the rifle used in the crimes. Ty Burrell (Modern Family) guest stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Southerlyn arrest a homeless man on suspicion of killing a fellow vagrant and gather enough evidence to bring a prosecution - but a clever defence attorney tries to get him exonerated by arguing that the laws of decent society do not apply to people who live on the streets

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a bookmaker whose testimony led to the incarceration of a Mob boss 10 years previously. The trail leads to an apparently reputable businessman with a sideline in contract killing who appears to be taking orders from the Mafia. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a motivational speaker who died after being pushed from a hotel balcony, and find themselves caught up in a protest against gay adoption laws. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The wives of two marines are murdered, and although Gibbs initially suspects they were victims of domestic violence, subsequent developments suggest the case may involve professional killers who already have their next victim in mind. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects a desperate US Marine may have faked his own death with the help of a friend and blown up an ambulance in a botched attempt to cover all traces of the subterfuge. Subsequent developments, including a mysterious disappearance, seem to confirm the hypothesis - until a timely discovery by Abby throws new light on the case

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to a national forest where several women have gone missing and conclude there may be a serial killer at large - a theory confirmed in gruesome fashion as the investigation proceeds. Drama, with Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.desc: Once-promising boxer Danny Ford is released from prison after serving time for his involvement in a dog-fighting ring, but he comes back under suspicion when the man whose evidence put him in jail turns up dead, apparently fatally mauled by dogs. programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate the murders of two scientists found stabbed to death following a fire. The evidence points to a mentally disturbed woman, but Cutter and Rubirosa suspect she may have been manipulated by someone else

programme.desc: The team is called to Seattle when a number of married couples are found murdered, and investigations show that the victims were all fostering young children

programme.title: NCIS

Gibbs and McGee travel to Russia to escort a computer expert connected to classified intel. Mark Harmon and Sean Murray star

programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy Lieutenant who has been murdered while on his way to a meeting with the President, and must ascertain whether the killing was part of a recent spate of muggings in the area - or a targeted hit to keep information secret. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette
